org.jamesframework.core.search.algo

Class SteepestDescent<SolutionType extends Solution>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamesframework.core.search.Search<SolutionType>
      • org.jamesframework.core.search.LocalSearch<SolutionType>
        • org.jamesframework.core.search.NeighbourhoodSearch<SolutionType>
          • org.jamesframework.core.search.SingleNeighbourhoodSearch<SolutionType>
            • org.jamesframework.core.search.algo.SteepestDescent<SolutionType>
  • Type Parameters:
    SolutionType - solution type of the problems that may be solved using this search, required to extend Solution
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class SteepestDescent<SolutionType extends Solution>
extends SingleNeighbourhoodSearch<SolutionType>
    Steepest descent algorithm, also referred to as hill climbing. In every search step, all neighbours of the current solution are evaluated and the best one is adopted as the new current solution, given that it is an improvement over the current solution. If the best neighbour is no improvement over the current solution, the search stops.
    Author:
    Herman De Beukelaer

    • Constructor Detail

      • SteepestDescent

        public SteepestDescent(Problem<SolutionType> problem,
                       Neighbourhood<? super SolutionType> neighbourhood)
        Creates a new steepest descent search, specifying the problem to solve and the neighbourhood used to modify the current solution. Neither arguments can be null. The search name defaults to "SteepestDescent".
        Parameters:
        problem - problem to solve
        neighbourhood - neighbourhood used to create neighbouring solutions
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if problem or neighbourhood are null

      • SteepestDescent

        public SteepestDescent(String name,
                       Problem<SolutionType> problem,
                       Neighbourhood<? super SolutionType> neighbourhood)
        Creates a new steepest descent search, specifying the problem to solve, the neighbourhood used to modify the current solution, and a custom search name. The problem and neighbourhood can not be null. The search name can be null in which case the default name "SteepestDescent" is assigned.
        Parameters:
        problem - problem to solve
        neighbourhood - neighbourhood used to create neighbouring solutions
        name - custom search name
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if problem or neighbourhood are null

    • Method Detail

      • searchStep

        protected void searchStep()
        Investigates all neighbours of the current solution and adopts the best one as the new current solution, if it is an improvement. If no improvement is found, the search is requested to stop and no further steps will be performed.
        Specified by:
        searchStep in class Search<SolutionType extends Solution>
        Throws:
        JamesRuntimeException - if depending on malfunctioning components (problem, neighbourhood, ...)
